Perspective On Monitoring
Perspective On Monitoring

1. Monitoring is Consistent With Our Mission:
1. Monitoring is Consistent With Our Mission:

“To provide a framework to coordinate and implement proven management practices, and test promising new management practices, designed to support environmental integrity and economic stability for communities of the Coos Watershed.”

implement proven management practices, and test i m p l e m e n t

support environmental integrity and economic
stability for communities of the Coos Watershed.”

2. Adaptive Management Approach Based on Walters’ and Holling’s (1990) “Large-Scale Management Experiments and Learning by Doing.”

Application of Basic Meteorological Data
Application of Basic Meteorological Data

Intense Winter Storms in December and January led to a number of road-related and in-unit landslides, especially on January 10th. Weather station data allowed determination of rainfall intensities and accumulation to evaluate road conditions.
